website_summaries.verdict: Provides enough leverage to power through light, medium, and some heavy-duty loosening tasks without bending or breaking.
pros: Strong enough to loosen rusted or over-tightened lug nuts
Enough leverage to loosen notoriously difficult axle nuts (though that is at the top of its range)
90-degree swivel stop makes it easier to use in tight engine compartment
cons: The small circumference and smooth finish of the handle make it difficult to push or pull
Swivel head has quite a bit of play in it

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Like another customer here, I purchased this for some automotive work (mainly removal of tires). Worked fine for one tire rotation. Then the second time I used it it completely broke at the point where the socket attaches. The bolts were torqued on well below the stated upper limit of this breaker bar. Resulted in a scuff to one of my rims... very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: cheekymonkey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste  your money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and unlike others, I ever used it. It sat in the back of my truck in a bin with sockets and two bottle jacks. Within 4 months of purchase I needed to use it. Unfortunately it was broken. The roll pin/pin had come out from the vibration of my truck. I was not at all pleased with the walk back to camp and then back to my truck for a tire tool. Spend your money on another brand.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: Not for automotive use...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove lug nuts. The part that you attach the socket to instantly broke within the first 30 seconds of using it. I would go with something more heavy duty for lug nuts and/or automotive use.
customer_reviews.author: AlanB

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed, snapped the head swapping out tires.
customer_reviews.text: Granted the bolts were seized and required some pretty good force to pop off, but you get what you pay for here, I feel like I broke this one, along with the 3/8 inch drive breaker bar, within 3 uses.
customer_reviews.author: iJKJames

customer_reviews.title: over 200lbs and it just took me standing on the end like it was another day in the park
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a HOSS! I bought it to break some lugnuts free that even my impact wrench was having issues with. I know what they rate the bar as in regards to what it can handle, but I stood on the end of it to break some of those lugs free, and it just flexed a little. Full grown man, over 200lbs and it just took me standing on the end like it was another day in the park. For the price, I figured it would break, but it didn't. I'm completely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Stretton

customer_reviews.title: 3/8 breaker bars are NOT meant for breaking lug nuts loose!
customer_reviews.text: I've been in the automotive repair business for over 40 years and own many tools. I purchased this 3/8 breaker bar to replace a Craftsman that disappeared awhile ago. For such a low price I wasn't expecting top of the line. It is well made and finished nicely although a bit thinner than the Craftsman. I've used it to break loose door hinge bolts and engine bracket bolts and it performed well. After viewing all the pics of the tool broken it clearly was not used for its intended purpose. My 1/2" air impact wrench with 500+ lbs of torque will struggle with a stubborn lug nut at times so I wouldn't ever use this breaker for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: OattieO

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good, haven't been able to break this yet.
customer_reviews.text: Actually failed to do the job, but not the fault of the tool. I put a 3' cheater bar on the end of this and still couldn't break the lugs free even standing and bouncing on it (I'm 240 lbs). HOWEVER: the breaker bar didn't fail despite my abuse of it. For the interested: no impact gun (even the huge 1" 2500 ft/lbs guns) could do the job. Breaker bar couldn't do the job. What finally DID do the job was the Cheater Wrench:
customer_reviews.author: Innocent Bystander

customer_reviews.title: 3/4” Breaker Bar Monster
customer_reviews.text: This thing is truly a beast! When reading the reviews keep in mind they are for 3/8 1/2 and 3/4 breaker bars all mixed together. As far as I'm concerned 3/8 and 1/2 breaker bars are not for seriously stuck bolts. I can break 1/2” breaker bars all day long, which I did before ordering this monster. This 3/4 bar is in a category by itself. I used a 4' pipe on the the end of this 2' bar and it broke the bolt free without any effort.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a faulty made tool
customer_reviews.text: Honest reveiw. This tool broke the 1st time it was used. I was very disappointed that a breaker bar snapped into pieces at the bolt on the 1st use. With that said though I contacted amazon and they informed me that it was covered under warranty through Capri tools. I emailed them pictures and they resent a brand new tool fast. That new tool hasn't broke while working on my Jeep. So good product but might have had a faulty one from the factory.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Burghardt

customer_reviews.title: tough bar
customer_reviews.text: Been using this 3/4" breaker bar for about a year now or longer. I use it mainly to tighten lug nuts on a 25k lb trailer. It's also used on anything I can't loosen or tighten with the 1/2" breaker. I used a 4' cheater pipe on it to try to break loose some very stubborn torque arm bolts on the trailer. I wasn't successful, but the bar held it's own. I did manage to break a 3/4" to 1/2" adapter during that little venture, but the bar was fine. I don't foresee myself breaking this bar from normal use. Maybe a longer cheater pipe would do it.
customer_reviews.author: mechtrician

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Its a good solid tool. Don't be an idiot and buy it to remove lug nuts! Buy a 1/2 inch breaker bar for that. This is for engine and light suspension.
customer_reviews.author: Pickyyethonest

customer_reviews.title: but appears sturdy..
customer_reviews.text: Yet to be tested, but appears sturdy... nice tool to have around...I can then use my attachment adaptor to switch it to 3/4", 1/2", 5/8", it's cheaper that way than for you to buy the 1/2" as it cost much more so I went for this cheaper one and bought cheap $5-$8 adapter sets as described above... so I saved me a pretty penny ;).
customer_reviews.author: The King of How To's

customer_reviews.title: Saved the day...
customer_reviews.text: My riding lawn mower cutting blade retaining flange nuts tend to be difficult to remove. A standard ratchet or large wrench just won't loosen them. It takes a big sturdy breaker bar to do the trick. This Capri Tools bar did the trick. I actually had to stand on the breaker bar before the bolt would budge, but the breaker bar held fast and shows no signs of damage. Great quality for the price. I'm quite satisfied and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond J. Alstrom

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been happy with this breaker bar. I recently used it to remove some locked up bolts on a showblower. They wouldn't budge with a standard 12" ratchet. I sheared the bolts right off with almost no effort with the extra leverage. I also use it to remove lugs from the wifes car after the dealership over torques them. I have not used it on anything 150 ft lbs or higher but it has performed flawlessly so far. For the price I wasn't expecting much, it has greatly exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered Sept 19th. Cost $15.16 and it broke after using it 4 or 5 times. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Edmondson

customer_reviews.title: Epic fail at the moment of truth
customer_reviews.text: I bought this long-handled model for my wisp of a daughter so she would have enough leverage to loosen and retighten lugnuts if she had a flat tire. It's pretty nice, except for when she went to use it the screw-pin that holds the socket drive fell out, rendering it useless. Luckily we were changing her snow tires in her garage and not on a dark roadside in the rain. I highly recommend some blue thread locker for this screw, and then everything will be jake.
customer_reviews.author: MrMike

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, low quality, could barely change 1 tire.
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy, ive used it once to change a tire on my suv and it was slightly bending as I was loosening the screws. The drive doesnt stay in place, it just flops back and fourth. Also the drive seems to be made out of very flimsy material, It could even be plastic! Spend more money and get a good brand name.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use...
customer_reviews.text: Broke on first use. Snapped one of the end-forks holding the black 3/4" drive lug. Looks like metal fork not properly heat-treated during manufacture. Amazon is processing refund...
customer_reviews.author: Range Officer

customer_reviews.title: For all the mechanics that wanna feel like a bad-ass
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid breaker bar. With such a simple design, without even any gears like you'd find in a wratchet, there's not much else to say. It gets the job done, and it's got a nice solid feel to it. And when you hold it, you kinda feel like a bad-ass because you could easily crack anybody upside the head with it. Seriously! Hold this in your hands and tell me you don't feel the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G.

customer_reviews.title: Worked 2 or 3 times, then snapped.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well the first two times I used it. Handle is a big wimpy feeling and slick. Snapped and broke Clea and scared the heck out of me on it's 3rd, maybe 4th use. Get a better brand or different material than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Sichol

customer_reviews.title: Held up fine under my abuse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for replacing the original rusted exhaust and O2 sensors on a 1993 Camry. I used this breaker bar with a 2 foot length of pipe on the end to remove some very rusted bolts with no problems. The head on one of the bolts even sheared. I've seen a couple pictures of broken breaker bars, but I definitely put mine through the wringer and it held up fine. Maybe there was a bad batch at some point, but based on the breaker bar I received, I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Corwin

customer_reviews.title: Solid Breaker Bar
customer_reviews.text: Solid extension breaker. I used this for replacing the struts on my car. This bar was perfect for getting leverage at those hard to reach angles. I did take off one star for the ball bearing and hex screw which act as the pivot point, popped out about halfway through the job. Thankfully I was able to find both of these and get them back in, but had I not this entire thing would be rendered useless. A little locktite fixed the problem perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Antithesis

customer_reviews.title: Glad I went with the 24 inch Breaker Bar
customer_reviews.text: I used these to remove my lug nuts and do a brake replacement. I'm glad I went with the 24" breaker bar, this one worked perfectly and will last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what it's designed to do
customer_reviews.text: Great breaker bar for under the hood or car. Not even close to being heavy enough for removing lug nuts. Most tire shops use impacts to reinstall wheels. 250-300ft lbs is probably the norm. This breaker bar is small enough to fit in tight spots. It will save your 3/8 ratchet or ratcheting wrench The low price! Makes it a must have
customer_reviews.author: BJP

customer_reviews.title: Great for when the zombies come!
customer_reviews.text: This two-foot long bar of metal was exactly what I needed to remove a stubborn screw on my cars starter motor! The length of it allowed me to get extra torque without any additional effort. It is pretty heavy though, so I would advise caution when using/transporting it. I also look forward to using it for survival when the zombie outbreak happens!
customer_reviews.author: Avril

customer_reviews.title: Really tough breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to break free axle bolts on my 260Z. They were torqued to 180-220 ft-lbs so I knew it would be tough. This breaker bar made it sooo easy! Levered against a bar-bell bar as shown in the pic. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BOBZCAR

customer_reviews.title: Strong, feels nice, makes jobs easy
customer_reviews.text: I needed to remove an axle nut. I had to jump on the bar with my entire weight to break the nut loose, but it held! Made suspension nuts a breeze to remove. Some of them I couldn't budge with a regular 1/2" ratchet. Like the position spring but wish it had more positions.
customer_reviews.author: bendodge

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the price range. I have used it multiple times for hard to break loose nuts and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: CLaston Lineberry

customer_reviews.title: Didn't feel strong enough.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't look very sturdy. I returned this because I found a 1/2 in breaker bar for less at harbor freight. I have an adapter for 1/2 to 3/8. Wish it felt more sturdy. Only returned it because it felt like it would break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Strong. Will bust her open. damn near threw my back out trying to bust a bolt. tossed this sucker on there and the whole car moved. Doesn't have to much flex so that torque feel isn't too prevalent. Great tool great pickup, must have for the irregular mechanic
customer_reviews.author: Evan Plutchok

customer_reviews.title: Low quality tool at a low quality price
customer_reviews.text: Goes without saying that a breaker bar is easy to use. And it's not too pricey for the size of it. I used this for a few automotive projects and it worked as one is supposed too, But yesterday I was trying to loosen a seized camber bolt, and the drive snapped right off. It's sort of like the harbor freight motto, Low Quality tools at Low quality prices. I would not advise buying this product. Just splurge on the extra few bucks and get a well known brand. I would not advise getting this product.
customer_reviews.author: huntsawesome123

customer_reviews.title: Buy two because one will break
customer_reviews.text: The first one broke into three pieces while breaking a wheel but loose. Second one did the job ok but felt like it too was going to explode into pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Great tool Thanks Capri Tools for your prompt and reliable ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool Thanks Capri Tools for your prompt and reliable service. I got my 3/8 drive extension on time, as advertised. I love the appearance and weight of the extension handle. Shiny chrome finish, looks high grade. It's heavy and feels solid to the touch. Gets those nuts tightened and unscrewed without much effort. The 3/8 socket drive rotates to screw and unscrew nuts quickly and locks with a click in place, love that. I am satisfied with my order and looks forward to making it a regular part of my tool set.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh maitre

customer_reviews.title: Breaker Bar
customer_reviews.text: When ordering tools like this, sometimes you don't know what you are going to get. With a long arm breaker bar, you can put a lot of leverage on the small 1/2" socket holder, and this one seems to be able to hold up to the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Parks

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material
customer_reviews.text: It broke at the head, one of the fork head sheared off clean, I welded it back. Cheap material
customer_reviews.author: Juday

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I put this to work on some rusty 33 mm bolts. They were really rusted on there. I had to use a 10 foot cheater bar - which bent. But this breaker bar did the job and no sign of weakness.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I broke the center bolt trying to take off the axle nut, on my truck. I don’t know why they made it this weak.
customer_reviews.author: hunter tilley

customer_reviews.title: let me down
customer_reviews.text: cheap. I bent the head first day I used it. also, take note this thing only has a 12" handle. not much of a breaker bar, that's almost the same as my ratchet.
customer_reviews.author: burningbaal

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Essential for engine and exhaust work
customer_reviews.text: Was unsure how long I needed and while this one is adequate, I'd get longer if I had it to do over. Beaide that, quality metal and heft, has not blinked at any bolt I've used it on. Bc of the force transmitted, dont use cheap sockets -- they will break.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, heavy, and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Did some research on reliable breaker bars after breaking the head off of a 3rd Harbor Freight breaker bar. After a lot of research this one seemed to be the best. I've only used it to remove my wheel logs, but it seems GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Savvyshopper

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Recently had a flat tire on my 2008 Highlander. The original tire iron supplied with the car was totally useless. The folks I use for all my tire related "stuff" torque the lug nuts at 80 to 90 ft-lb at least. I decided I needed to get a replacement. This thing, with a 21 mm impact socket (from amazon), did the trick! No problem with lug nuts now!
customer_reviews.author: Jamtn

customer_reviews.title: Great, but 2 years later broke it :(
customer_reviews.text: I loved this, but trying to get off a stubborn hub nut on my car, ended up shearing the bolt. Too bad, it was good while it lasted, but not made of the strongest 4030 steel like the professional ones :( I wish I still had it.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in my bag.
customer_reviews.text: Best tool in my bag. Bolts and Nuts have one of two options, come off, for break off. Be sure to get a 3/4 to 1/2 adapter to be able to use you more common sockets. I took the Castle nuts off of my axles with just this bar (and socket of course), no additional pipes just a little controlled jumping.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Strong tool.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Used it to tighten up a hitch ball. Had to put all my weight on the end of the bar and jump on it a few times. The chrome finish comes off rather easy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt & Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It's a really big socket wrench. It got the freewheel off my bike.
customer_reviews.text: It's a really big socket wrench. It provides a lot of torque, which is useful when one pairs this wrench with aandto wrench stubborn freewheels off bikes. Admittedly, I don't have much to say about it, except that maybe it would be nicer if the handle had been Plasti Dipped at least.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell 💖🦊🚲

customer_reviews.title: Great Breaker Bar
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to use with a 3/8" drive 15/16" socket to remove the flywheel nut on my Briggs & Stratton lawnmower engine and it was absolutely perfect. I am glad to have this in my tool box, I needed one any way (using a hollow pipe on my socket wrench isn't exactly the safest way...) and the quality of this tool makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carenza

customer_reviews.title: Mine broke early on
customer_reviews.text: I broke mine while trying to remove a lug nut from my jeep. The square part that goes into the socket sheered off. I was using it in a normal fashion without pipe extensions or jumping up and down on it. Breaker bars are supposed to be for heavy duty applications where you don't want to risk breaking your ratchet. Can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: David Solinsky

customer_reviews.title: Faulty ball detent
customer_reviews.text: It's a strong breaker bar but the functionality isn't as good as I hoped. The little ball detent on the 3/8 drive grabs onto sockets extremely strong. So much so that the sockets are impossible to remove from the breaker bar by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah

customer_reviews.title: strong
customer_reviews.text: had to replace the wheel bearings on a tahoe with 200,000 miles. im 6-2 300 lbs and bounced up and down on this and it took the beating. cannot ask for better then that.
customer_reviews.author: Fatman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, affordable Breaker Bar
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool because I had lent my other one to a friend and never got it back. Very good quality and competes with the higher priced competition. It does one job and it does it well. Why spend more if you don't need to?
customer_reviews.author: Nick W.

customer_reviews.title: Put your money toward a better breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: I had this item less than a year and only used it 10 times, if that, and it broke. It's rated to 150+ ft/lbs and my wheel lugs are only torqued to 77 ft/lbs and it snapped at the head, trying to loosen a lug. As they say, "you get what you pay for" but at the rated torque I figured it would do the job, but I guess not. Put your money toward a better breaker bar.
customer_reviews.author: JHH

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: With all the 5 start reviews I thought I couldn’t go wrong. First time using this it bent at the hinge. I did not use this breaker bar beyond its 159lb recommendation. Not happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Carmensandiego

customer_reviews.title: This tool feels sturdy in my hand and it's definitely pretty good quality
customer_reviews.text: This tool feels sturdy in my hand and it's definitely pretty good quality. I thought it would be longer, but I didn't take the time to measure out the length with a ruler before purchasing. It isn't all that much longer than a regular ratchet. The swivel head also pivoted without me meaning for it to. Next time I'll probably buy a fixed head and longer breaker bar.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Broke when trying to remove simple lug nuts from a ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke when trying to remove simple lug nuts from a wheel. I'd return it but I don't want to pay for packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Durable.
customer_reviews.text: Not Durable. Broke while trying to unscrew a bolt. Not for heavy duty mechanical work.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Angelo Askew

customer_reviews.title: The length is wrong
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 18 inch 3/8ths drive , only problem is its not 18 inches , its 17 inches. I am going to keep it, should do the job I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN W WISE JR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Must have tool for anyone who works on their own cars. This is great for getting off those really tough lug nuts or any really stuck bolt/screws. Also the best way to tighten without air tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Nice breaker but also get a cheater bar.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well getting a caliper bolt unstuck. It a good tool to have. I would also recommend getting a 1/2 too. A cheater bar would also be recommended to give you more leverage. Update- Still going strong. I see a lot of people posting breaks. It would't surprise me that they used it beyond it's limits. That's normally what happens to tools with user error. Also I noticed the price is higher. When I got mine years ago it was 14.99.
customer_reviews.author: Mike41

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Good long breaker bar for the money. I've used it twice since purchasing, it's sturdy and the sockets stay nice and snug to it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: Excellent breaker bar. Used this to remove the spark plugs on my eight-year-old Jeep. Worked flawlessly. Great breaker bar for the price
customer_reviews.author: Skeetorius

customer_reviews.title: Thumb your nose at King-Kong with this breaker bar!
customer_reviews.text: With this wrench I was able to loosen some lug-nuts that King-Kong tightened the last time he got his mitts on it. I couldn't do it with my 17" breaker bar but it was easy-peasy with this 24" breaker bar!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: It has an awesome double box screw holding the bearing in place that ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to change the rear wheel bearings on my VW Rabbit. It has an awesome double box screw holding the bearing in place that is torqued on by an elephant. This did the trick. I did have to stand on it but it took the abuse, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: although i purchased the wrong size they worked well with return and just holding the tool I can tell it would last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Prefect tool for wheel removal and those tough bolts/nuts
customer_reviews.text: That among other uses of course, but like any breaker bar just don’t abuse it.any tool will break if you over stress it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Heavy. Inexpensive product using inexpensive steel, but work perfect. Strong and does what it was meant to. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a quality tool, I have used it a couple of times with no issues. It's a nice size when you need leverage but space will not allow the use a longer bar. Pleased with this purchase and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Tripp

customer_reviews.title: It's a breaker bar, and it works. I ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a breaker bar, and it works. I have only tested it on wheel lugnuts that were tightened at a shop, so it might have been a little over 80 ft-lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Wife got a trailer to move her paddle boards and we needed this and the correct wheel socket in case she ever got a flat on the trailer. Sits in the back of her car just in case
customer_reviews.author: Chad Hegerty

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming but well made
customer_reviews.text: Decent tool, but not long enough to get much more leverage than a regular ratchet. Its a well made tool though
customer_reviews.author: aaron marcus

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It broke the first time I tried to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Phteven

customer_reviews.title: Low quality built
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bar for a brake job. While using it for the first time, the tip snapped when trying to remove one of the caliper carrier bolts. Waste of money. Spend the extra money and buy a higher quality breaker bar. This one is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Great Bar with adjustable head
customer_reviews.text: Great Breaker Bar with plenty of leverage. The fully polished chrome finish is excellent. If you want to tighten the head just use a 5mm Allan wrench and adjust it the way you like it.
customer_reviews.author: atlas

customer_reviews.title: Worked as needed for light use
customer_reviews.text: Cracked the Honda Odyssey transmission drain bolt with ease. However the 3/8" piece seems to be plastic and probably not designed for heavy use. Will most likely only use once every couple years for drain bolt. May want to consider another option for heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: JRabDawg

customer_reviews.title: We struggled with replacing the heater element until we bought ...
customer_reviews.text: We struggled with replacing the heater element until we bought this breaker bar to remove the element. It was just the right tool to get it done.
customer_reviews.author: Dubs

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted over 2 years, but today it snapped :( trying to remove an axel nut. Works fine for lug nuts, but when you need REAL torque, it doesn't hold up. Ah well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Seems good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought to change tires on my RV. Seems good quality but it is not used every day.
customer_reviews.author: Al R.

customer_reviews.title: Good bar.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got one of these. When it arrived, I was a little disapointed that it wasn't longer (guess I should have known from the description, but I found my first stubborn bolt recently, and I remembered buying this. Popped it off easily.
customer_reviews.author: M. Eilman

customer_reviews.title: useful for brake job!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this breaker bar to do a brake job. Nice to have. Don't jump on it though!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse A. Safir

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Solid build. Feels good and heavy. Only used it once for one screw. Saved money instead taking it to a shop.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: broke doing tire change
customer_reviews.text: it worked for a while but as others have said it broke while doing tire change on truck and warranty..well it costs more to ship then to buy a new one so worthless really!! Harbor Freight better deal walk in get a new one free if it breaks
customer_reviews.author: Fred Caprotta

customer_reviews.title: Priced lower then most and better then others.
customer_reviews.text: held up and broke axels nuts loose that previous bars broke and no leverage bar was needed.
customer_reviews.author: John smith

customer_reviews.title: 30 inches should give me the extra torque.
customer_reviews.text: It looks good. I haven't had to use it yet. Tired of lugnuts being torqued to over 105 #.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: For the price, can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Don't need a big breaker bar. This is strong enough to use with a cheater bar, it can handle it. I've used it alot with no problem. Even used it to remove headbolts.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Didnt expect much when i ordered it, however it takes more torque than i expected. I've had breaker bars before for working on my car and this has been of solid quality for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It busted my nut
customer_reviews.text: This broke free my stuck axle nut. Tried a consumer impact gun that did nothing. Bought this bad boy and had it off in minutes. Had to jump up and down on it to break the nut free but it worked. If you are reading this and were like me, stuck trying to free your axle nut for further repair, get this and a matching socket. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Ian J.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice 3/8" breakover
customer_reviews.text: Very nice 3/8" breakover. Nice finish, long enough to do nearly anything you need to in 3/8" drive. Appearance reminds you of higher priced tool truck breakovers.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: which I don't like, but it was up to the task of ...
customer_reviews.text: This bar kicks butt. No problem removing a stuck axle bolt. Longer arm is an advantage over the 24" Craftsman. The pin holding the square thingy you pop the socket on is a little sloppy, which I don't like, but it was up to the task of putting about 600 lb-ft of torque on a stuck nut.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cumbey

customer_reviews.title: 12 inches, of True Breaker Bar
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Breaker Bar, just right for those hard to reach place. Where a Rachet wrench will not be able to loosen the nuts or bolts. At 12" in length makes it work wonders. A must have tool, for your tool box!
customer_reviews.author: felrodriosTop Contributor: Welding

customer_reviews.title: Great size for most work on a car
customer_reviews.text: Great size for most work on a car. I was able to remove brake caliper bracket bolts from the knuckle with this. It's not a very long breaker bar, so it's portable, but long enough to give your elbow grease some leverage.
customer_reviews.author: smart shopper

customer_reviews.title: Capri tools has won my trust
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised as to how well constructed this breaker bar is. I hadn't heard of Capri tools but now I can trust that brand for any tools I buy in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MBKSYS

customer_reviews.title: Great for those VW/Audi axle bolts!
customer_reviews.text: This breaker bar makes quick work of torquing those axle bolts on VW/Audi cars. I struggled with my 1/2" bar, but this 3/4" bar did it with no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not so nice!
customer_reviews.text: I curious about this Capri tool line so I ordered this and have to say I was a bit disappointed. The quality of the finish is sub par (see attached photo), the inner edges are sharp enough to cut you if you're not careful. I guess it would do the job, but you could do much better at this price point
customer_reviews.author: mn

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: It worked exactly as expected. Great price. I just wish it had some knurling or something on the handle to help with grip when it gets greasy.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Crane

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: love it, easy to use and work's well. sturdy and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this breaker bar for a short period of time and used it only a few times. My initial impression is that it is sturdy and well-constructed. Certainly a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Solid, has yet to break
customer_reviews.text: Have used it a few times for breaking lug nuts. Has yet to bend or break. there is some flex but it always bounces right back. Good buy
customer_reviews.author: I hate walmart

customer_reviews.title: Great size for my Mazda 6 as anything longer would ...
customer_reviews.text: Great size for my Mazda 6 as anything longer would be a pain to use in that wheel well. This got the job done to loosen the bolts for my calipers when i was servicing the brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Stugi

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, does not flex under tension. Good quality for the price. I am not a professional mechanic I use it in my home garage.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ucciardi III

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: This breaker bar is a necessity in any tool box
customer_reviews.author: Bobcat

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, effective.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected of a cheap bar, but definitely a good tool. The head has a little bit of play, that was a little disappointing. Look forward to getting the 40 inch 1/2 drive.
customer_reviews.author: robert

product_meta.title: Capri Tools 1/2 Inch Drive Extension Breaker Bar, 377 ft-lb, 24 inches
product_meta.description: Size:1/2" Drive / StandardThis powerful breaker bar functions as an extension bar that securely holds socket wrench style sockets with extra leverage to break loose frozen and stuck nuts and bolts. The Chrome-Vanadium head is elegantly paired with a Chrome-Moly head, making for an extremely strong and durable breaker bar. The sockets are kept firmly secure by the spring loaded ball bearing. The head is rotatable 180 degrees to provide you with dynamic options for a variety of jobs. Absolute quality is guaranteed as it meets DIN standards and comes with a Capri Tools lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: 1/2 inch drive, 24 inches long, 377 ft-lb capacity breaker bar
Chrome-Vanadium body and Chrome-Moly head for extra strength
Sockets are securely held due to the spring loaded ball bearing
Rotates 180 degrees for dynamic utilization in a variety of jobs
Meets DIN standards and comes with a lifetime warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,050 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
